sections.title: Common questions about replacing one tooth

faqs.question: How long does a single implant take?
faqs.answer: Many cases take several months from placement to final crown, depending on healing and whether a temporary tooth is needed.

faqs.question: Will the implant match my other teeth?
faqs.answer: We photograph and shade-map the neighbouring teeth so the final crown blends in shape, colour, and texture.

faqs.question: Can I have a temporary tooth?
faqs.answer: We can often provide a provisional solution to maintain your smile while the implant integrates.

faqs.question: Does it hurt?
faqs.answer: Placement uses local anaesthetic and gentle techniques; most patients describe pressure rather than pain, with soreness managed afterwards.

faqs.question: How do I care for the implant at home?
faqs.answer: We show you how to brush and use cleaning aids around the implant to keep the gumline healthy.

faqs.question: Am I suitable for an implant?
faqs.answer: We assess bone levels, gum health, and medical history in Shoreham-by-Sea to confirm if an implant is the safest choice.
